meanings.sent1: Her vison allowed her to admire the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: His vison was clear, and he could spot the tiny details.
meanings.sent3: With his keen vison, he could even see the smallest insects.
meanings.sent4: Her vison was like a hawk, never missing a thing.
meanings.sent5: The eagle's vison was so sharp, it could spot its prey from high above.

meanings.sent1: The artist had a clear vison of the painting in his mind.
meanings.sent2: Her vison of the future was filled with hope and happiness.
meanings.sent3: His vison of the alien invasion was both scary and funny.
meanings.sent4: The dream felt so real, as if it was a vison from another world.
meanings.sent5: The vison of a peaceful garden helped her relax and unwind.

meanings.definition: A plan or idea for the future
meanings.sent1: His vison for the company's growth was ambitious yet achievable.
meanings.sent2: She shared her vison for the project, hoping others would be inspired.
meanings.sent3: Their vison for the party was to make it the best one ever.
meanings.sent4: The vison of a better world kept them motivated to work hard.
meanings.sent5: His vison for the new invention was innovative and groundbreaking.
